=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Keanu Review Date: 2016/10/28 Categories: Comedy, Action, Intense, Fun Product Description: ['Cousins hatch a plot to retrieve a stolen cat by posing as drug dealers for a street gang.'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Peter Atencio'], 'Producers': ['Keegan-Michael Key', 'Jordan Peele', 'Peter Principato', 'Paul Young', 'Joel Zadak'], 'Starring': ['Jordan Peele', 'Keegan-Michael Key', 'Tiffany Haddish']} Review Text: it had a few funny scenes but I could only suffer through 30-40mins till I got bored and started washing clothes instead. I like the main actors. I would like to see them in a better movie. Review Title: Kinda funny but lost interest less than half way through.... Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/12/06 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['J Blakeson'], 'Producers': ['Tobey Maguire'], 'Starring': ['Chloë Grace Moretz', 'Nick Robinson', 'Ron Livingston'], 'Studio': ['Columbia Pictures']} Review Text: Just terrible....and cheesy. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/04/19 Average Rating: 3.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Schenkman'], 'Producers': ['Richard Schenkman', 'Eric D. Wilkinso'], 'Starring': ['David Lee Smith', 'Sterling Knight', 'Michael Dorn'], 'Studio': ['WowNow Entertainment']} Review Text: This was a VERY disappointing sequel to the original which was an awesome plot/story that was riveting.

Don't ruin your memory from the original and pretend this turd doesn't exist. Review Title: I agree with most of everybody else Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Shazam! Review Date: 2019/07/20 Categories: Fantasy, Comedy, Exciting, Sweet Product Description: ['Billy Batson is a streetwise 14-year-old who can magically transform into the adult superhero Shazam simply by shouting out one word. His newfound powers soon get put to the test when he squares off against the evil Dr. Thaddeus Sivana.'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Sandberg'], 'Producers': ['Peter Safran'], 'Starring': ['Zachary Levi', 'Asher Angel', 'Mark Strong']} Review Text: I'm not going to write a long explanation.

It's a good story, likable characters, lots of humor with a splash of seriousness and a decent bad guy. They improved the series dialogue.

The general CGI was good for an Amazon production. I really liked the movie sets and clothing. It seems to have an Irish feel. Review Title: Good Fantasy story Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/10/05 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dexter Fletcher'], 'Producers': ['Matthew Vaughn', 'David Furnish', 'Adam Bohling', 'David Reid', 'Elton John', 'Claudia Vaughn', 'Brian Oliver', 'Steve Hamilton Shaw', 'Michael Gracey'], 'Starring': ['Taron Egerton', 'Jamie Bell', 'Richard Madden']} Review Text: First off, I have a lot of downloaded Elton John music. Having said that, this movie was a terrible musical. I want my money back. I hated it from the very opening scene. I struggled and fast forwarded over half way through and still the same.

I want my $5 back. Review Title: Great Musician.....Terrible musical.....I hated it Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/10/05 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Neil Marshall'], 'Producers': ['Lawrence Gordon', 'Lloyd Levin', 'Mike Richardson', 'Philip Westgren', 'Carl Hampe', 'Matt O’toole', 'Les Weldon'], 'Starring': ['David Harbour', 'Milla Jovovich', 'Ian McShane'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']} Review Text: This movie is very close to the original Hell boy with Ron Perlman. They didn't change a whole lot from the orginal movie. It has better CGI and the actor is a little darker but I'm so glad I rented with a Prime discount of $2.99.

I wouldn't recommend this movie to a friend but I might to an enemy to get them to waste money. Review Title: Blah movie Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/10/05 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', 'Українська', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Sam Esmail', 'Kyle Patrick Alvarez'], 'Producers': ['Sam Esmail', 'Matt Lieber', 'Micah Bloomberg', 'Alex Blumberg', 'Chris Giliberti', 'Marisa Yeres Gill', 'Lisa Roberts Gillan', 'Chad Hamilton', 'Eli Horowitz'], 'Starring': ['Julia Roberts', 'Bobby Cannavale', 'Stephan James']} Review Text: I Just started watching this series mainly due to the fact that I'm obsessed with Julia Robert's lips. This series is slow moving but has great acting/actors/actresses and an original plot. I also enjoyed because it was 10 episodes of 30 minutes so I wasn't clock invested as much. I read that Julia is not reprising her role but remaining a producer. If this is true, I won't watch the next season. I hate when they replace actors in lead roles. Review Title: Enjoyable and original plot Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/12/23 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'हिन्दी', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Türkçe', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', 'Українська', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Amy Sherman-Palladino', 'Daniel Palladino', 'Dan Attias'], 'Producers': ['Amy Sherman-Palladino', 'Daniel Palladino', 'Dhana Gilbert', 'Daniel Goldfarb', 'Kate Fodor', 'Sono Patel'], 'Starring': ['Rachel Brosnahan', 'Alex Borstein', 'Michael Zegen']} Review Text: Just as good as the first two seasons but different. Season 1 focused on the life of a comic. Season 2 delves into Jewish american lifestyles. Season 3 is about show business and how back stabbing it is with focus on family dynamics and turmoil.

These One-star reviewers seem to think this is a documentary of the 60s. ITS A COMEDY-DRAMA SERIES not a Ken Burn's special. A lot of bozo reviewers on here think they are Roger Ebert or Gene Siskel or something. OMG. its a great show. Review Title: Great Show Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/12/28 Average Rating: 3.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Stephen Durham'], 'Producers': ['Stephen Durham', 'Hemdee Kiwanuka'], 'Starring': ['Ellen Hollman', 'Matt Passmore', 'Geraldine Singer'], 'Studio': ["Uncork'd Entertainment"]} Review Text: All you need to know is that the lead actress (very fine by the way) kills a bad guy from 10 feet away while he is fully auto shooting at her and another women. She spins around and jumps and does a body roll and throws a knife and seemed to hit the guy in the belly while he is fully auto on an M4 rifle. I stopped the movie right there. Review Title: An embarassment to action movies Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2022/04/16 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jon Watts'], 'Producers': ['Kevin Feige', 'Amy Pascal'], 'Starring': ['Tom Holland', 'Zendaya', 'Jamie Foxx'], 'Studio': ['SONY PICTURES ENTERTAINMENT', 'INC.']} Review Text: This movie had a good plot line and CGI. The last few years, All the Sony/Marvel movies have been slowly degrading in quality in my opinion. I enjoyed it and hardly checked my watch/clock as it played out. If a movie is subpar, I won't stay concentrated and look at the time and see how long the movie has been playing. Review Title: Much better than I thought it would be Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2022/10/31 Average Rating: 3.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert Eggers'], 'Producers': ['Lars Knudsen', 'Mark Huffam', 'Robert Eggers', 'Alexander Skarsgård', 'Arnon Milchan'], 'Starring': ['Alexander Skarsgård', 'Nicole Kidman', 'Claes Bang'], 'Studio': ['Focus Features']} Review Text: I'm going to keep this short and unsweet. This movie was pretty bad. Several times I almost stopped it during the viewing. The plot is traditional revenge theme but its goofy blending action with fantasy super human slow motion fight scenes. Think "300" but much worse. Review Title: Disappointing with high end cast Rating: 2.0 --------------------------------------------------

Review Title: Disappointing with high end cast Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual exhibits a distinct preference for entertaining films with humor and engaging storylines, often gravitating toward genres like fantasy and action-comedy. Sentiment analysis reveals a strong dichotomy in appreciation; while some movies receive high ratings for humor and character appeal, others lead to disappointment due to lackluster plots or sequels that don't measure up to their predecessors. 

Frequent usage of keywords such as "boring," "terrible," and "enjoyable" illuminates a keen sensitivity to quality, suggesting that while the individual enjoys spirited narratives, they are easily deterred by poor execution. Reviews emphasize character and plot enjoyment, particularly in humorous settings, with a recurring disdain for films deemed cheesy or derivative. 

Price sensitivity appears moderate, as indicated by mentions of discounts and desire for value in rental decisions. The individual's reactions also suggest a preference for strong performances, particularly those of identifiable leads, as evidenced by praises for certain actors and critiques when roles are poorly cast or substitutions occur. 

Overall, core preferences reflect a desire for quality content that fuses humor with engaging storytelling, an aversion to films perceived as stale or low-budget, and an appreciation for strong character-driven narratives.
